Table of Contents

Struct MarginPadding

Namespace
osu.Framework.Graphics
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

Holds data about the margin or padding of a Drawable. The margin describes the size of an empty area around its Drawable, while the padding describes the size of an empty area inside its container.

public struct MarginPadding : IInterpolable<MarginPadding>, IEquatable<MarginPadding>
Implements
IInterpolable<MarginPadding>
IEquatable<MarginPadding>

Constructors

MarginPadding(float)

Initializes all four sides (Left, Right, Top and Bottom) to the given value.

public MarginPadding(float allSides)

Parameters

allSides float

The absolute size of the space that should be left around every side of the Drawable.

Fields

Bottom

The absolute size of the space that should be left empty below the Drawable if used as margin, or the absolute size of the space that should be left empty from the bottom of the container if used as padding.

public float Bottom

Field Value

float

Left

The absolute size of the space that should be left empty to the left of the Drawable if used as margin, or the absolute size of the space that should be left empty from the left of the container if used as padding.

public float Left

Field Value

float

Right

The absolute size of the space that should be left empty to the right of the Drawable if used as margin, or the absolute size of the space that should be left empty from the right of the container if used as padding.

public float Right

Field Value

float

Top

The absolute size of the space that should be left empty above the Drawable if used as margin, or the absolute size of the space that should be left empty from the top of the container if used as padding.

public float Top

Field Value

float

Properties

Horizontal

Sets the values of both Left and Right to the assigned value.

public float Horizontal { set; }

Property Value

float

Total

Gets the total absolute size of the empty space horizontally (x coordinate) and vertically (y coordinate) around the Drawable or inside the container if used as padding.

public readonly Vector2 Total { get; }

Property Value

Vector2

TotalHorizontal

Gets the total absolute size of the empty space horizontally around the Drawable if used as margin, or the absolute size of the space left empty from the right and left of the container if used as padding. Effectively Right + Left.

public readonly float TotalHorizontal { get; }

Property Value

float

TotalVertical

Gets the total absolute size of the empty space vertically around the Drawable or the absolute size of the space left empty from the top and bottom of the container if used as padding. Effectively Top + Bottom.

public readonly float TotalVertical { get; }

Property Value

float

Vertical

Sets the values of both Top and Bottom to the assigned value.

public float Vertical { set; }

Property Value

float

ValueAt<TEasing>(double, MarginPadding, MarginPadding, double, double, in TEasing)

Interpolates between two MarginPaddings.

public MarginPadding ValueAt<TEasing>(double time, MarginPadding startValue, MarginPadding endValue, double startTime, double endTime, in TEasing easing) where TEasing : IEasingFunction
